objects.name: All_Changes
objects.search_constraints: tag=change NOT (object_category=file OR object_category=directory OR object_category=registry)

fields.name: action
fields.comment: The action performed on the resource.

fields.name: change_type
fields.comment: The type of change, such as filesystem or AAA (authentication, authorization, and accounting).

fields.name: command
fields.comment: The command that initiated the change.

fields.name: dest
fields.comment: The resource where change occurred. You can alias this from more specific fields not included in this data model, such as dest_host, dest_ip, or dest_name.

fields.name: dvc
fields.comment: The device that reported the change, if applicable, such as a FIP or CIM server. You can alias this from more specific fields not included in this data model, such as dvc_host, dvc_ip, or dvc_name.

fields.name: object
fields.comment: Name of the affected object on the resource (such as a router interface, user account, or server volume).

fields.name: object_attrs
fields.comment: The attributes that were updated on the updated resource object, if applicable.

fields.name: object_category
fields.comment: Generic name for the class of the updated resource object. Expected values may be specific to an app.

fields.name: object_id
fields.comment: The unique updated resource object ID as presented to the system, if applicable (for instance, a SID, UUID, or GUID value).

fields.name: object_path
fields.comment: The path of the modified resource object, if applicable (such as a file, directory, or volume).

fields.name: result
fields.comment: The vendor-specific result of a change, or clarification of an action status. For instance, status=failure may be accompanied by result=blocked by policy or result=disk full. result is a string. Please use a msg_severity_id field (not included in the data model) for severity ID fields that are integer data types.

fields.name: result_id
fields.comment: A result indicator for an action status.

fields.name: src
fields.comment: The resource where the change was originated. You can alias this from more specific fields not included in the data model, such as src_host, src_ip, or src_name.

fields.name: status
fields.comment: Status of the update.

fields.name: tag
fields.comment: This automatically generated field is used to access tags from within data models. Add-on builders do not need to populate it.

fields.name: user
fields.comment: The user or entity performing the change. For account changes, this is the account that was changed (see src_user for user or entity performing the change).

fields.name: vendor_product
fields.comment: The vendor and product or service that detected the change. This field can be automatically populated by vendor and product fields in your data.

fields.name: dest_nt_domain
fields.comment: The NT domain of the destination, if applicable.

fields.name: src_nt_domain
fields.comment: The NT domain of the source, if applicable.

fields.name: src_user
fields.comment: For account changes, the user or entity performing the change.
